item.title: Cavour Co Tassel Loafers Review
item.description: I had been eyeing Cavour’s house brand for quite some time. Their shoes are made in Spain Goodyear welt (GYW) construction in lots of solid leathers for around +$320 with a few really nice details that I love. They went on sale for around $250 so I jumped on a pair of brown suede tassel loafers. I was drawn to Cavour’s house brand partly because of the price-point, but also a lot of the construction details that put these over the top for me.

item.title: Bedos Leatherworks Toe Taps Review
item.description: Bedo’s Leather Works is a cobbler business located in Falls Church VA and is currently run by Steve Doudaklian. Steve does a lot of amazing work on seemingly anything made of leather. You might be familiar with some of his videos where he restored a pair of Allen Edmonds Strands or his famous Florshiem restorations. Check out his YoutTube channel it’s mesmerizing. New Alden Loafers I recently got a pair of wonderful Alden shell loafers from Brick & Mortar Seattle (above) and I wanted to extend the life of the soles a little.

item.title: Using Multiple Custom Domains With Github Pages
item.description: When setting up this blog I decided I wanted to use a different domain than the main one I already had. I spent quite a bit of time trying to figure out if it was possible to use GitHub Pages to use multiple custom domains for multiple repositories and exactly how to do it. I finally found this post which set me straight on both counts. Here are both the steps outlined again and a non-exhaustive list of the things I bumped into but ultimately were not part of the solution.

item.title: First Post
item.description: My First Blog Post Hey, Alex here! It’s been a goal of mine to have a blog/website for little posts and thoughts that I have about things. So here it is! I’m using the static-site generator Hugo to build this. I just have to configure the theme to make the site look nice and I can write posts using markdown for formatting. I’m hosting it using GitHub Pages which is super easy and I highly recommend for static sites.
